title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice (Covid), Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, vulnerable children and families benefit from improved child protection and social protection services

related-activity.ref: 4350/A0/06/883 IMPROVED CHILD PROTECTION AND SOCIAL PROTECTION SERVICES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: The quality and coverage of child protection/GBV programmes was enhanced and expanded through the delivery and strengthening of statutory and community-based CP services, including Mental Health and Psychosocial Support (MHPSS), family strengthening interventions, GBV and CEFM prevention and response, CP/GBV case management and inter-sectoral referrals, including in humanitarian settings. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2022

Status of selected programmes/ mechanisms to operationalize the alternative care policy, Text

baseline.value: Alternative care options and system for CWD and UASC are not in line with international standards. Emergency foster care system not existent. Specialized foster care for CWD not existent; Emergency foster care not existent. Family separation Preventio

target.value: 2025:Alternative care options for CWD and UASC revised in line with international standards. Emergency foster care system tested and scaled up Specialized foster care system for CWD sclae up plan is developed and endorsed Strategy and Action Plan to strengh

actual.value: 2021:UNICEF has closely worked with the MoFSS to support the transition from an institutional care system to family based alternative care. The basic foster care training programme was revised and finalized, targeting 6.758 foster families and 8.217 children.

title.narrative: Status of Inter- sectoral Coordination mechanism between key government institutions and CSO for delivery of child protection services, Text

baseline.value: Mechanism not existent Intersectoral Coordination Mechanism exists but it is limited and does not include CSOs

target.value: 2025:Mechanism designed and officially established Local and national level intersectoral coordination bodies are effectively operational and include CSOs

actual.value: 2021:Fully achieved: UNICEF has supported the development of normative frameworks to address barriers related to unclear roles in child protection services provision and inconsistent standards for case management and care. The assessment framework for the soci

title.narrative: Degree of Development of the Quality Assurance System for Social Work , Text

target.value: 2025:Well developed Organizational standards to implement policies and regulations endorsed by MoFLSS and implemented at sub-national level Standards and curricula of different cadres of Social Service Workforce are better defined and improved.

actual.value: 2021:SSW assessment has been initiated with Ministry of Family and Social Services to analyze the current status of the SSW. The ToR has been developed. UNICEF has also supported MoFSS to improve SSW capacity through remote training programmes. Over 538 staff
